alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cape Girardeau; Mississippi; New Madrid; Scott; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Union, Pulaski, southwestern Johnson, Alexander, Mississippi, Scott, New Madrid, Stoddard, southeastern Butler and southeastern Cape Girardeau Counties through 200 AM CST... At 114 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dutchtown to near Glennonville Missouri. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cape Girardeau, Scott City, Kelso and Dutchtown around 120 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Tamms, Essex, Morehouse, Dongola, Canalou, Sikeston, Matthews, Miner, Charleston, East Prairie, Vienna and Bertrand. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois near Mile Marker 16. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 27. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 1 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 32 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cape Girardeau; Mississippi; New Madrid; Scott; Stoddard
